metadata.title: CVE-2021-29450 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description: Wordpress is an open source CMS. One of the blocks in the WordPress editorcan be exploited in a way that exposes password-protected posts and pages.This requires at least contributor privileges. This has been patched inWordPress 5.7.1, along with the older affected versions via minor releases.It's strongly recommended that you keep auto-updates enabled to receive thefix.

criterions.comment: wordpress: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
